snippet: Jean-Claude Juncker of Luxembourg bowed Wednesday to outrage over revelations of a litany of abuses by his tiny country’s wayward intelligence service and declared that he would step down as prime minister.
abstract: Jean-Claude Juncker of Luxembourg, longest serving leader in European Union, bows to outrage over revelations of a litany of abuses by his tiny country’s wayward intelligence service and declares that he will step down as prime minister.
lead_paragraph: Jean-Claude Juncker of Luxembourg bowed Wednesday to outrage over revelations of a litany of abuses by his tiny country’s wayward intelligence service and declared that he would step down as prime minister.

headline.main: Luxembourg Spy Scandal Forces Exit of Premier
headline.print_headline: Luxembourg Spy Scandal Forces Exit Of Premier
